Key Match Events: Germany substitute Niclas Füllkrug scored late to give the European Championship host a morale-boosting 2-1 win over the Netherlands in their friendly on Tuesday.
Germany recovered from conceding an early goal and eventually won the match 2-1.
Pre-Game Insights: Germany coach Julian Nagelsmann had asked for a character test in the face of adversity for his players, which the team responded to with ball possession.
Post-Match Reflections: Nagelsmann said, "Today we had an even more challenging game than against the French, because the variability that Holland has in the build-up is extraordinary, with a lot of positional changes."
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the Deutsche Bank Park in Frankfurt, Germany, and thousands of German fans had signed a petition to make Peter Schilling’s 1980s hit "Major Tom" the official German goal-jingle.
Others: Germany next plays in June against Ukraine and Greece for its final Euro 2024 warmup games, and it opens the tournament against Scotland in Munich on June 14.
